bookmark.title: Upton Tea Imports
bookmark.desc: Purveyor of the world's finest teas.

bookmark.title: Penzeys Spices
bookmark.desc: The best way to get your herbs and spices (both in terms of price, quality, and flavor). Their print catalog is wonderfully educational, and full of recipes.

bookmark.title: Dirty Potato Chips
bookmark.desc: My very favorite potato chips. Their motto is, "We don't wash out the natural potato flavor, so our chips are crunchier and tastier."

bookmark.title: Art's and Mary's: Homestyle Tater Chips
bookmark.desc: These are very good too. I usually get the "Dill Tater Chips", since dill chips are not commonly found.

bookmark.title: Tim's Cascade Style Potato Chips
bookmark.desc: My chip of choice when I'm in the Pacific Northwest (or whenever else I can find these in New England!). All are good -- especially the "Cracked Peppercorn"!

bookmark.title: Cape Cod Potato Chips
bookmark.desc: Cape Code offers excellent chips made from different potato varieties (Dark Russet, Golden Russet and Yukon Gold). The "Firecracker Barbeque" chips don't last long when I'm around.
